r_table2scatter.py - R based plots and stats¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This script reads a table from a file or stdin. It can compute various stats (correlations, ...) and/or plot the data using R.

Usage¶

Example:

python r_table2scatter.py --help

Type:

python r_table2scatter.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: r_table2scatter.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -c COLUMNS, --columns=COLUMNS
                        columns to take from table. Choices are 'all', 'all-
                        but-first' or a ','-separated list of columns.
  --logscale=LOGSCALE   log-transform one or both axes [default=%Default].
  -a FILE, --hardcopy=FILE
                        write hardcopy to file [default=none].
  -f FILE, --file=FILE  filename with table data [default=].
  -2 FILE, --file2=FILE
                        additional data file [default=none].
  -s STATISTICS, --stats=STATISTICS
                        statistical quantities to compute [default=[]]
  -p PLOT, --plot=PLOT  plots to plot [default=[]]
  -t THRESHOLD, --threshold=THRESHOLD
                        min threshold to use for counting method
                        [default=0.0].
  -o COLOURS, --colours=COLOURS
                        column with colour information [default=none].
  -l LABELS, --labels=LABELS
                        column labels for x and y in matched plots
                        [default=x,y].
  -d, --add-diagonal    add diagonal to plot [default=none].
  -e LEGEND, --legend=LEGEND
                        column with legend [default=none].
  -r R_OPTIONS, --options=R_OPTIONS
                        R plotting options [default=].
  --format=FORMAT       output format [default=full].
  --title=TITLE         plot title [default=none].
  --xrange=XRANGE       x viewing range of plot [default=none].
  --yrange=YRANGE       y viewing range of plot[default=none].
  --allow-empty         do not fail on empty input [default=True].
  --fail-on-empty       fail on empty input [default=True].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
